meanings.definition: A person who struts, especially a proud or self-important one.
meanings.sent1: The strutter walked down the street with a confident swagger.
meanings.sent2: The peacock was the biggest strutter in the yard, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent3: The little strutter thought he was the king of the playground.
meanings.sent4: Among the pigeons, he was the strutter, always showing off his shiny feathers.
meanings.sent5: The peacock was a true strutter, parading around as if he owned the place.

meanings.definition: A structural member used to support or stiffen a framework.
meanings.sent1: The builder added a strong strutter to reinforce the roof.
meanings.sent2: The strutter helped keep the bridge steady during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The little strutter was crucial in holding the treehouse together.
meanings.sent4: The strutter stood firm, supporting the weight of the entire structure.
meanings.sent5: The strutter was like the backbone of the building, ensuring its stability.

meanings.sent1: The strutter proudly displayed his feathers during mating season.
meanings.sent2: The farmer pointed out the strutter among the flock of turkeys.
meanings.sent3: The noisy strutter woke everyone up with his early morning calls.
meanings.sent4: The strutter strutted around the farm, showing off to the hens.
meanings.sent5: The colorful strutter was the center of attention during Thanksgiving.
